Reviews.Title: “Great place close to the downtown!”
Reviews.Author: Anettp
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one week in February and was totally satisfied with it. The downtown is just a short walk, it's close to the university area, to the ROM, and to Yorkville, the most exclusive area of Toronto with designer shops and fabulous restaurants. The room is ok, the beds are veeeeery big and comfortable, the staff at the reception was very helpful when my partner said that we need a refrigerant, they brought one just a little bit later. There is a quite good wifi in the room, and taking a shower was the best part of our stay!:) The hotel has a restaurant/pub as well, where u can find every kind of meal: from mexican quesadilla to english fish&chips.. If I ever go back to Toronto, I would not hesitate to choose this place again!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, staff and location!”
Reviews.Author: Jillian D
Reviews.Content: Love staying at this hotel every time I am in Toronto. It is right downtown, free internet in lobby, large, clean rooms, good staff and right around the corner from the subway station. The hotel has a great restaurant/pub attached which sells delicious food at great prices! I can't say enough about this hotel, it is my favorite in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, Friendly Staff and excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: thisfridaythe13th
Reviews.Content: I was worried, after reading previous reviews, that my hotel room might not be clean enough or might infested with the dreaded b-word. After emailing the hotel manager about my concerns I was assured that the hotel was clean. I found my room to be very clean and cozy, even the bathroom. The bed was comfortable. There was a little noise outside the room from other guests. The price was great, but did not include a free breakfast. Luckily the hotel's locale is perfect and there are tons of restaurants on the same street(I went to Fresh twice). There are also tons of stores and coffee shops on Bloor Street. Bloor street felt safe and I walked after dark. The parking was around $20 for the underground parking garage, and the car was fine. The staff was sooo friendly from check in to check out and in between. One staff member gave directions gallore during a very goofy conversation, and others were just smiley and nice. I forgot my sunglasses in my room, after check out, but a hotel employee gladly called up to housekeeping and had them retrieve the glasses for me in record time. The location was excellent and I can't stress that enough. This is a good spot for a two day vacation, and you could certainly stay right in the bloor street area and have a great time and plenty to do especially if you enjoy restaurants and shopping. I LOVED this hotel and would stay again, and probably will.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced poor state of cleanliness of rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Accountnut
Reviews.Content: Carpets in room sticky, stain rings I'm night table sticky, toilet bowl under the rim black mould or mildew same for the tank lid. I usually book Holiday inns for business and personal to sim it up this is the only time I have had a bad experience with the Brand. I will not rebook this location. On another note out of managements control the attached restaurant the Fox and Fiddle offers substandard food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Sub-standard property - think twice before staying here”
Reviews.Author: Nomad099
Reviews.Content: We booked in for 3 nights back in July 2011 and unfortunately were really unimpressed by this place. The main reason was the noise from a) protesters and b) drunken idiots falling about over the corridors, both of which the hotel felt were beyond their responsibility... that could be true if a) the protesters weren't members of the staff, and b) the drunken people were allowed to continue partying in the corridor and then pass out there. Come on - I mean if you stayed in a youth hostel, you might expect that, but a property which is trying to cater for families and so on, should not allow this sort of thing to happen. Pub next door was Irish - served its purpose and had good selection of beer on draught - probably should've drunk more of it to forget about the rants of "holiday inn, no back down" from the cleaning staff protesters.

Reviews.Title: “Another side of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: mtl-wasa
Reviews.Content: Nice location near Torontoâ€™s Annex area, close to convenience store, a beer store, and a grocery store. The Yorkville area with its glamourous bars and shops is only a block away. The rooms and beds are comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location right on Bloor with subway next door”
Reviews.Author: ALLIGATOR9
Reviews.Content: A good Holiday Inn property next to the Bloor Station and across the University and within 5 minutes of shopping area which is like the Fifth Avenue of Toronto. Comfortable big rooms, helpfull staff and a nice bar with good music. I had a scare though when a very old lady who seemed to be lost, got into the elevator and walked into my room which coincidentally had a lock malfunctioning and the hotel staff was fixing it with the door open. They thought the lady was my relative and fortunately I was returning to the room to pick up something so avoided a big problem. On raising an alarm, the reception tried talking to the lady who spoke a foreign language and left the hotel before the police could come. I wonder if such instances are avoidable.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location and good transport links to get to downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: pickle66
Reviews.Content: As a single female traveller I did wonder if I was going to be in a good location and be comfortable with my stay.... needn't have worried at all The staff on reception were really helpful and friendly, my room was perfect for my three night stay and the location was great - a few minutes walk to the subway and safe. On one of my days I walked in to downtown Toronto, walking through the university grounds and found a fab little cafe for breakfast I didn't eat at the hotel but I did have a drink in the pub/bar on the ground floor. Nice and friendly and again great service Room was very clean, comfortable bed and pillows and shower great All in all a great place to stay and would have no hesitation in going back there again on my next visit to Toronto

Reviews.Title: “OK, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: PolarBear777
Reviews.Content: Short stay for business. Rooms are a bit dated, but hotel was clean and there were no issues. Convenient location on Bloor St. near subway. Access to nearby fitness facilities is a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Really fine hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tamaski
Reviews.Content: Had a fine 3-day stay in this good mid-range hotel -- the room was great, staff were really helpful, super convenient location -- what more can I say? Only concern I had was the parking cost ... but it is probably normal for downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “bed bug horror”
Reviews.Author: Chris L
Reviews.Content: Despite complaining of blood stains on bedding (a tell-tale sign of fecal matter from bedbugs) on our first night, we unknowingly spent another night in our room only to find three live bed bugs. Imagine how many more were in the room! Though the hotel helped clean our clothes and steam our suitcases, we need to insist on pro-active, NOT reactive measures. Over the course of the next week, I ended up with over two hundred bites that rose into welts all over my body. It was a terrible ordeal.

Reviews.Title: “Mid range pleasant hotel - don't forget your credit card.”
Reviews.Author: Ducko
Reviews.Content: Just spent five days at this hotel, prior to attending my son's wedding to a Canadian girl later in the week. On a main road, just opposite the Bata Shoe Museum, the hotel was very comfortable and the staff could not have been more helpful. One of our cases was damaged during the flight, and an enquiry at Reception saw a roll of Gaffa Tape appear by magic to enable me to make a temporary repair. Reception even sorted out a reservation on the Hop-on, Hop-off Sightseeing Bus service for us, arranging for the bus to stop outside the hotel to pick us up. Top Marks for that. Eating is a minor hiccup at the hotel as the only place to eat was the adjacent Fox and Fiddle pub, ideally located for an evening pint and meal, but not ideal for breakfast with a lingering odour of last night's antics and carpet cleaning activities going on whilst we were eating. As UK silver surfers on limited funds we also found prices everywhere fairly daunting. Probably reasonable for the locals (my son's wife as a window dresser in an upmarket store chain earns twice as much as he does in England, and he is a High School Teacher!), but at first we were worried about stretching our budget to survive. Bargains such as Happy Hour pitchers of delicious Canadian Lager for just over Â£8 helped ease the pain and after the first day we just stopped worrying and put everything on the credit card to sort out later. After all, we shall only be passing this way once and life is too short to worry! I did enjoy the steak and eggs breakfast one morning and all the food we ate there was excellent and served in generous portions. One thing which constantly upset our budgetting was the habit of adding sales tax and a service charge of 15 percent on every bill without any indication on the menu, adding about 25 percent to the prices shown. The hotel room was excellent. Two large, comfortable double beds, adjustable air conditioning, power shower and a 26 inch flat screen TV made the place feel like home from home. The first time I turned on the TV I got Coronation Street from about 12 months ago followed by promotional breaks pushing X Factor every half hour or so - welcome to Canada! May I recomend the sightseeing bus service to everyone - one ticket lasts for a week and includes a boat trip around the islands in the bay on the Lake with a spectacuar view of the Toronto skyline on the return. There is a commentary on the sights as the tour progresses and you can hop on or off at 24 points en route, with buses running every 40 minutes. Well worth the cost for a week long "taxi" service. On the day we checked out we were pleasantly surprised to get an envelope pushed under the door which listed the items we had charged to the room so we could check them at leisure prior to settling up when we left. All in all, a very happy stay at a reasonable quality hotel which I would recomend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location for exploring..........”
Reviews.Author: TonyJudge
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only 1 night and used primarily as a base for Niagara Falls but also to explore Toronto. Very easy to get to from St George subway station and only took approx 45min from airport, via 192 Skyrocket to Kipling and subway to St Georges. 5min walk to hotel from St Georges. Rooms were very clean and tidy. Had booked through Hotwire and pleased with this hotel being chosen for us. We chose to walk everywhere when exploring Toronto and very easy to navigate around. Got a very good breakfast from teh pub next door and good large portions. Everyone working in the hotel was friendly and helpful, bedding and towels were clean, and we were able to leave our bags for the day while we took a coach tour down to Niagara. Nothing to complain about!!

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: cherikin
Reviews.Content: Great location, as it's close to subways, shops, restaurants, university, and the Toronto Baha'i Centre. Staff are helpful, and rooms are comfortable, well maintained, and nicely decorated. It gives the feeling of being like a smaller hotel, and well run.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: susan2305
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 3 nights at the Bloor Yorkville Holiday Inn. The location was perfect - just a half block from the St. George subway station which gives access to both the east/west and north/south lines. It is easy to explore the city without having to bother with a car. The hotel is clean and well equipped. The room was large and comfortable. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful, and the complimentary PC access was uselful for those of us who still travel without our laptops! As a woman in my 60's travelling on my own I felt perfectly safe in the area at night - I even took the subway back to the hotel after attending an evening play in the entertainment district. This location is quieter than the more central location, and in my view, more interesting with its easy access to the Bata and Royal Ontario museums, the University and Chinatown. There are lots of restaurants within easy walking distance and, for the budget conscious, there is a Tim Horten's just a block away for a quick bite, and a Metro grocery store a block in the other direction if you want to buy your own meal fixings. There is no pool in the hotel, but guests have access to the facilities at the community centre up the street. Local calls are free for Priority Club members. The only real drawback is that the hotel is not on the hotel bus route from the airport, necessitating either a pricey cab ride ($55+) or a lenghty ride on public transit if you're travelling from the airport. Overall impression - a really comfortable and convenient hotel at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ruetzMildmay_Ontario
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Holiday Inn on Bloor - Yorkville. Perfect location in the city for walking and exploring the Yorkville area, the Bata Shoe Museum and the Royal Ontario Museum. Even the 'Chinatown' street markets are an easy walk. The hotel was clean and desk staff was very cordial and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Some good + some bad = average”
Reviews.Author: Ispahan1
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this Holiday Inn while visiting the University of Toronto. It's massive--14 stories--and being high up probably helped minimize the noise from Bloor Street. The bed was comfortable and the shower worked well. The television and the Internet service were another matter. The TV set is ancient, the color balance was way off, and worst, there was no coverage of the English Premier League on Saturday. (In the States the match I wanted to watch was on ESPN, which isn't in Canada). The WiFi service was easy to connect to, but it was maddingly slow. I needed to work from the room, and that took about three times as long as it needed to just waiting to connect. I would not recommend this hotel for anyone who needs the Internet for anything more than an occasional email check.

Reviews.Title: “A great find, glad we booked”
Reviews.Author: Andrew D
Reviews.Content: Located just outside the city centre, next to the university campus, but ideally located for the subway or for a walk into town past some of the sights. Great room & good value. On-site underground car park (small fee). Very pleasant desk staff, and we were able to check-in early - great as we had just arrived from an international flight and wanted to freshen-up before going off to explore the town. Restaurant didn't look much - typical themed pub - so we went out and found a great nearby restaurant (Harbord House).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for price and the amenities”
Reviews.Author: cartjen
Reviews.Content: One of the key things for me when I travel is having a fitness centre in the hotel. While the fitness centre is limited at this one, they have arrangements to allow free access to the giant fitness and pool facility one block away, which is also open 24 hours. Sitting on two key subway roots and several streetcar and bus routes, this hotel is situated in a lovely part of Toronto, especially during events like TIFF or if you're visiting UofT. If you're in doubt about eateries onsite, just ask the front desk; given it's at Bloor and Spadina, many many eateries are either a short walk or a very short subway ride away. The bed was comfortable, room clean and very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely situated comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wolffian
Reviews.Content: My experience with this hotel was fine, no major problems or issues. Desk staff were extremely helpful, had a 10th floor room with a comfortable queen bed, all the basic amenities. Could hear some noise in corridors but no more than in many hotels. I liked the location because it was near the University and easy walking distance to the metro. I tried the food in the pub next door, not exactly memorable and did not eat there after that one time.

Reviews.Title: “Great, if breakfasts were better”
Reviews.Author: Catriona07
Reviews.Content: This is very conveniently located, and top-floor rooms are a delight in themselves. The only drawback is the breakfast room (??), which is in fact the pub next door (Fox & Fiddle), so no buffet, hardly any choice, and less than acceptable waiting times (especially at the week-end). When we were there the first time in 2009 there was another cafeteria next door, and that was really very nice, but it seems to have closed down: hopefully something else will open up with decent breakfast options?

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: travelling_elisa
Reviews.Content: We are a young couple and we spent 2 nights in this hotel during our honeymoon. The staff was extremely helpful for the check-in/check-out procedures; they also helped us in arranging a last-minute trip to Niagara Falls. Our room was very big and clean. Room service was accurate. The hotel is located in a very convenient area: there is a subway station nearby and a street with many restaurants at walk distance. On the whole we are very satisfied with our stay and we would choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “MEH!”
Reviews.Author: PhilipWei
Reviews.Content: I guess for 150 a night in the downtown area it was expected to get a cubicle, however when I have gone to other major cities across North America I have gotten better for the value. Seemingly the idiots on our floor were loud all day and night long partying away and security barely made their presence known at any point in time. If I chose to go to Toronto again I would stay in the area, however I would pony up more to stay anywhere but here. If I am paying decent dollar to stay a place I would expect better than a 20x30 (or less) room without any leaky faucets or baby sized tvs that my spare bedroom has a larger than the 24". Frankly my laptop monitor was almost better

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: AverageTravelGal
Reviews.Content: Arrived Saturday night to celebrate Carribana in the city. We stayed on the top floor (14th). The room had a fridge, tv, queen bed, and a view of some condos and the north side of the city. Not all the lights worked in the room (end table lamps). Three people shared this room, so our request for a cot was filled right away. The hotel was very quiet - especially considering that it was Carribana and I had expected a lot of noise. The rooms were clean and tidy - some carpet wear throughout the hotel, some paint peeling and marks on the walls, and our bathtub was not in prestine condition, but this was a very enjoyable stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Awful awful awful!!!”
Reviews.Author: USResidentCanada
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here! Especially if you have kids!! Apparently the management refuses to give it's workers employment contracts, and because of the labor dispute there are EXTREMELY loud protests outside the hotel daily from 7-8am. Unless you stay above the 9th floor, it WILL wake your children up! If it doesn't, the loud recycling trucks that come every night will do the trick. Some people may also be offended by the huge advertisement for beer painted on the side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: LDM499
Reviews.Content: The bed was good, decor average, connected pub satisfactory, but great location!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: matrxica
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights and here are my pros and cons based on my stay; Pros: Very clean, friendly front-desk staff, free internet, underground parking, and a convenient location for shopping and dining in the Yorkville/Bloor st. area. Cons: Dated rooms with an old CRT TV, bathroom faucets had to be adjusted via trial and error to get the right water temperature, early morning labor picketing which woke me up every morning, and lastly and the most annoying was the mix up with parking. I got invoices twice for $69 each time stuck to my windshield even though I had registered my car with the hotel and was being charged separtely. Apparently, the parking is owned by a private company, and it seemed like the parking patrol staff on duty did not get a timely updated of the list of hotel guest license plates. Hopefully, this will be corrected and those invoices will be cancelled as promised by the front-desk staff. Overall, this hotel rates well on cleanliness and comfortable beds which bodes well for me. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable but not for the price”
Reviews.Author: jamei304
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean (at least the beds appeared to be) and quiet (except for a few noisy guests) which is just what I need from a hotel, but it needs to do a lot more to justify it's room rate. The rooms were very dated, old giant CRT TVs and hideous pictures on the walls. I made the mistake of moving one of the chairs out of a corner and found a thick layer of dust along the skirting and a half-eaten biscuit on the floor, both of which remained after the following day's room service. The coffee machine was so filthy I didn't use it initially until in desperation on one particularly early morning I scrubbed it out with hot water in the bath, the floor of which again was the wrong shade of grey. Having said that, the bedding was clean and the beds and pillows comfortable. I once enquired about the cost of international calls and was told "the prices vary and are very expensive so why not go out and buy a phone card from a nearby shop". While it's great that I was given the most appropriate advice, you'd think the hotel could partner with a phone company to offer acceptable rates that people might actually use. I'd stay here again if everywhere else was booked up, but I think it would be easy to find somewhere better for a lower price. The location however is convenient being next to a subway station and within a short walk to the university. It's also on a tour bus route.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: TxAggie87
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, we discovered that although we had reserved a rollaway bed online through Holiday Inn, this property doesn't allow for rollaway beds. The front desk clerk was not very helpful when we discovered this issue. So, I requested an extra full bedding set for one of my children to use on the floor. When we arrived to our room, the bathroom was not filthy, but not very clean. The rooms- and hallways- definitely need updating. The worst part, though, was that we discovered fresh blood on one of the blankets. Disgusting! Since it was late, we just pulled it off and slept w/out a blanket. In the morning we reported this issue to the front desk, and requested a new blanket. When we returned after our day of sightseeing, the same disgusting blanket was back on the bed! I spoke to the front desk, and requested a full new set of bedding- pillow cases and all. They quickly came and did the change. During check-out, I was asked how our stay was. I explained that we were not satisfied, and the manager came to speak with me. I told him everything that happened, and he offered money off of our 1st night. It was kind of him to do this, and I appreciated it. However, the whole hotel could use a facelift, and we wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Its alright”
Reviews.Author: AirRiedle1
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean, beds ok, no free parking and a little far away from the city center. If you come to toronto for sightseeing and do not want to walk, you better want to stay closer to the center. If you are looking for a cheaper but comfortable and clean middle class hotel - come here! We booked via hotwire so we actually and no real choice but did not get disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Basic Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: chicagotravelgirl
Reviews.Content: This is a good bargain in downtown Toronto. We stayed at the more expensive Delta Chelsea two weeks prior which was a bit dirty and loud. At the less expensive Holiday Inn Yorkville, the small lobby is clean and new. The rooms are a bit worn but very quiet and clean. The bathrooms don't have marble or granite but personally, I'd rather have what's there be clean than fancy. The staff is helpful and friendly. I had a really friendly and amazingly efficient Thai waitress one morning at the pub downstairs. She knew I was in a hurry and got me in and out fast with a smile. The location is great for high end shopping in Yorkville or visiting a college student. The parking was reasonable (for downtown) and the wifi was free. What more do you need on a business trip?

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: llipgh58
Reviews.Content: I was very happy I chose this hotel. Very clean, with courtesy and helpful staff. The location is excellent. Walking distance to museums, shops and restaurants, and only a block for the St. George subway station. If you a looking for a clean, comfortable place to stay, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: traveller111111
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here more than once on University of Toronto business and it's always been fine. The rooms live up to the no-surprises motto; decent and upscale though nothing too fancy. There's not much to the hotel except the rooms, but there are numerous restaurants, coffee shops and stores nearby. I've had no problems with street noise. Free wireless (and computers in the lobby). Hassle-free parking at about $20/night. In addition to the no-surprises room, the big advantage is location. For those unfamiliar with Toronto, this is an excellent choice because it is a safe yet lively area, right beside a major subway station, and reasonable walking distance to many places. As a former Torontonian, I can't think of a better location that offers such a good combination of these.

Reviews.Title: “Freshly renovated accomodations”
Reviews.Author: arilistam
Reviews.Content: Room and bedding comfortable. Room temperature was too warm as hotel had not converted yet to spring/summer settings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Silknsaber
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at the Holiday Inn on Bloor Street! This hotel is in a great location downtown near the Bata Shoe Gallery and within walking distance of the Royal Ontario Museum, shopping and great restaurants. I was very impressed with the staff at the front desk when I checked in. I was greeted as a platinum member and was offered a complimentary upgrade. I stayed in a King size bedroom on the 11th floor. The bed was very comfortable and having a fridge in the room was very convenient. The rooms were very well kept. The Pub downstairs was Ok. It was busy in the evening and was good to go for drink and hang out with friends. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AngelaKN
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay in Toronto. Hotel was located near great restaurants, shops, and museums. Subway was only steps away and the ride to CN Tower/Roger Centre was only about 15 minutes. Room was comfortable and staff was pleasant. Went to the restaurant located at the hotel the first night, would not go back...so many other places to eat close by.

Reviews.Title: “Top #1 - Service”
Reviews.Author: PatsMart
Reviews.Content: This hotel will become my favorite location in Toronto after my last stay. I was attending a meeting outside the hotel, when I decided to leave earlier due to bad weather. Unfortunately my luggage were note done and still in my room. I called the hotel and did speak to the GM and explain to him the situation. He took on himself to have my luggage done and got it deliver to my meeting within an hour. WOW ! I got on time at the airport and was able to get home safely. Thanks Holiday Inn Bloor Yorkville !!!

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: raccoonalist
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The location was excellent, the subway (and Horton's) was just around the corner and the neighbourhood turned out to be cosy with nice restaurants close by. The room was big and clean, and a newspaper was delivered to our door every morning. The free laundry room was a plus. The wi-fi wasn't the most reliable but worked most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, average hotel”
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn--Toronto (Midtown) for one night, and it was an average stay. Staff at the front desk was very friendly and helpful, the room was average (what I expected), but clean. Bed was very comfortable. Fast check in and check out, reasonable parking rates. Location was great, close to many restaurants and the subway. Overall, a decent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: lukesmom
Reviews.Content: My family, which includes two teenagers, stayed here recently on a Friday night. I was concerned about other posts which talked about noise due to the fact that the hotel is located next to U of T. There was no problem at all with noise, even though I did see what appeared to be college age students at the hotel. The location of the HI is perfect if you are coming to Toronto to do some museum hopping, as we were. It is directly across from the Bata, and I short walk to the ROM. The subway line that takes you down to the entertainment district is right around the cornor. The staff was friendly and helpful when we asked for information about the neighborhood. It's a great location to walk around in and even though it was a bitterly cold night we did not have to walk far to find several interest ethnic restaurants to choose from to eat. The problem that other posters have mentioned about the internet speed must have been worked on. My kids had their laptop with them and used the free internet in the room. They said the speed was fine. The only problem we had with the hotel was the size of the bed for my sons to share. I don't know if there was an option to get two queen size beds, but the double bed was too small for my two big guys.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, excellent value, location and cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: 154913Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: I was visiting from Calgary with three teenage daughters with the purpose to tour UofT and shop. I chose this hotel for its very close location of university and downtown shopping. it is not fance (i.e. no concierge or taxi stand) but overall, it exceeded my expectations ..... it was extremely clean and the beds were excellent. The room was a little small for 4 of us but we were out most of the time. The first night we arrived very late and got the last double room. It was an inferior location just about the garbage bins but I requested to move to a higher floor with a view and the front desk staff was very willing to help. The parking was convenient and again good value. I woud recommend this hotel for travellers looking for good value and superb location near the university. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: astronat
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. Gym was smallish - but about typical for a hotel gym. I went running in the neighbourhood around the hotel, which was nice and scenic. The staff were friendly and courteous, rooms clean, modern and spacious for a downtown hotel. Price was reasonable (but I had a corporate rate). Very close to the university of toronto, lots of restaurants and pubs, and also close to public transit and the yorkville shopping area. All in all, a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Slow internet.”
Reviews.Author: CanadaTwo
Reviews.Content: For those of us that need a good internet connection when we travel, this was a bit of a disappointment. I have access to a Bell Turbo stick, but like to use the hotel internet when available. Using two different speed tests (CNET, DLSreports) I can get 1.8 to 2.0 times faster connection with the Bell Turbo stick than with the in-room wired connection. The hotel is convenient and not too expensive. $22/night for parking is a bit high, but its good til the next evening, apparently.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: fishr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from Sept.3-7. We chose it because we were helping our son move into residence at University of Toronto and the hotel is right on the edge of the campus. Also we got a great price through Expedia. Our problem with the hotel was that three out of the four nights we spent there we had very little sleep. Unfortunately being so close to U of T and being inexpensive the hotel caters to University students. We were awakened at 3 AM every night by rowdy partiers on our floor. I had to call the front desk repeatedly to deal with the. Each day I was told that the offenders were gone but the next night we'd have the same problem, so either they were lying to us or more rowdies were checking in each day. We would never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing not to recommend”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior30
Reviews.Content: RECOMMENDED. All hotel recommendations need to take into account the price paid. We booked this on a Priceline and got a good deal. The hotel is centrally located for any visit to Toronto and steps to the metro. Checkin was quick and friendly. Hotel is a bit worn, but generally was in good working condition. Room was large and clean. Some room to room noise. Bedding was quite comfortable. Average lighting. Bathroom is a bit small & nothing special but all fixtures in good repair. Internet access is FREE but dreadfully slow. We stayed on a weekend and sadly the first night young kids having a party across the hall, marred the evening, however, security was on it. There is plenty of food choices within 2-3 blocks. Overall, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: Westgirly
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. The rooms were clean, comfy and modern. The staff was helpful. There are two computers in the lobby for guest use. The adjoining restaurant is clean and friendly. The hotel offers free washing machines and dryers to guest - that room was clean and quiet. The hotel is within walking distance of UT and many local attractions, including the Art Gallery of Toronto, the Royal Conservatory, Koreatown, Kensington Market etc. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It's just okay”
Reviews.Author: Lederfrau
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff are very friendly. They are happy to provide you with maps and give pointers to areas of interest in the city. The hotel is about half a block from St George subway station. I was somewhat disappointed when I went to the room. It's certainly nothing great. I've stayed at better Holiday Inns. It is older so the soundproofing isn't as great compared to some of the newer buildings I've stayed in. I could hear my neighbours speaking next door, not enough to know what they were talking about but it kept me up until 2:30 am. Even though I was far from the elevator a mechanical whirring woke me up a few times. When I went to turn the light off I found something from a previous guest. Not gross, just wasn't mine. To be fair to the cleaners it was tucked in at the back of the phone. Towels and bedding were newer. The pillows were labeled as soft or firm. The carpet looked like it needed to be replaced. I was nervous about sitting in the office chair so I put a towel over it. Nothing was super dirty but it wasn't clean either. I checked for bedbugs as I do with every hotel and I did not find any, nor did I have any mystery bug bites. If you are comparing the Holiday Inn Express on Lombard to this Holiday Inn, they're about the same from a "refresh" standpoint and on cleanliness. This HI has nicer soaps and amenities. You get beakfast at the HI Express so you can work that into your price comparisons if you are thinking of staying at one of them. That said, I wouldn't stay at either again. If you are only looking for somewhere to rest your head while you are on vacation you might not be concerned about some of the things that I did not like. If you are traveling on business I would recommend paying extra and going to the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average Accomodations...You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: earllee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bloor Holiday Inn during the weekend of July 9-11. We booked this place through Hotwire at less than $100/night, and hoped that it would be a great value. Upon checking in we found that parking was an astounding $22/night. It was great that we didn't opt to park their during our stay because the lot closes after 12 am (something that the rather curt front desk woman completely left out). Ok. lets get to the point of this review. Our hotel stay was pretty dismal. The showers made a noise whenever you attempted to use the hot water. It reminds me of the noise that pipes make after they have been frozen. The bathtub wouldnt drain properly and left you in about 5 inches of standing water after taking the obscenely noisy shower. We decided to ask the attendant if we could change rooms (after they sent the hotel maintenance to "fix" the shower issue which they couldnt). In our new room on the same floor the shower issue was still there although not as bad, and we found a new plumbing issue- the bathroom sink also leaked! This seems to be a hotel that is often frequented by large groups of younger people on trips, etc. So, if you are traveling with a family steer clear at all costs. We were awakened at 230 am one night by drunken shouting and the slamming of doors by a large party of hooligans who invaded our entire floor during the second day of our stay. Also, none of the hotel rooms come equipped with refrigerators. It will cost you an additional $10/day to rent them, which is absurd. If you are a young backpacker on a shoestring budget then this hotel is for you. However, if you are looking for quality and overall value in a hotel look elsewhere. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location AND Quality...”
Reviews.Author: MDA78
Reviews.Content: The exterior of the hotel might not be all that appealing, but i must say that the rooms are very clean, tidy, and feel quite fresh. Being quite sensitive to dust and given my gruesome experience with stuffy, dusty rooms at some big hotels in downtown Toronto, I was totally impressed with my room here. Front Desk ladies are attentive and fast. The reservations person was busy with another guest, so the reception lady immediately offered to check me in so as not to keep me waiting. She actually checked me in in no more than 3 minutes. (The lady at the Westin Harborfront during my last visit took 12 minutes to check me in on a quiet Sunday morning while she chatting on her cell phone) Maybe I'm too picky, but these small details make the difference to me. A standard room gave me exactly what I needed for a comfortable weekend stay: A bed with a medium-hard mattress (unlike the super soft ones I disliked at most other downtown hotels), a coffee machine, a good sized fridge, free wireless internet, and big multi-style sprinkle shower head, and my own iron & ironing board. Room rates are certainly overpriced but I think it depends on what you're willing to pay a premium for. In my case it was this superb dust-free environment in the rooms and corridors, plus one heck of a good AC ! I haven't had any bad experience with noise (probably because it was a weekend) but I think asking for a higher floor (10th-14th) could be an advantage since noise from traffic congestion on Bloor St. might be irritating during weekdays. The Spadina subway station is just around the corner, as is a whole bunch of eateries, museum, UofT, shopping,...basically everything. These guys got my next reservation, well done !

Reviews.Title: “the bad marginally outweighs the good”
Reviews.Author: empress_cherry
Reviews.Content: good things: - the hotel is just across the road from the brilliant Bata Shoe Musuem and a comfortable walk to the Royal Ontario Musuem and the chic shopping on Bloor St W near Yonge St - my room was very large and was clean enough - internet in the lobby is free (though rather slow) bad things: - there are no door-to-door shuttles in Toronto and the fixed route shuttle does not stop in this area - a taxi or towncar costs $57 (before tip) - the service level is variable - the guy at the front desk on the afternoon I checked in was really friendly and helpful but the guy there in the mornings was rather snooty (at a Holiday Inn??!!) - there are no 'ready for service' signs for the doors, so housekeeping make lots of noise banging on doors in the morning - however, to the credit of the housekeeping lady, when she saw that I'd complained about that on the comment card she left an apology note and tried to make less noise the next morning - I recieved a bill for zillions of phone calls that I didn't make, when I complained they were removed but I didn't get an explaination or apolgy! I paid 151AUD/night including taxes via Expedia (because I wanted the option to cancel, it would have been a fair bit less if I'd taken the no cancellation deal), on balance I think that's about fair but if in Toronto again I'd try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “High speed internet non existent”
Reviews.Author: big_eye_29
Reviews.Content: The hotel claims to have high speed wireless internet. My download speed was 2k/sec. Took 3 minutes to load cnn.com. I asked the front desk and they said it was because there were too many guests using it. I checked at 3:00am and problem was the same. Made it impossible to do business critical work. Other than that the hotel was average.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Hotel but Skip the Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: 2eratics
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at this hotel for business and had no issues whatsoever with the hotel. The staff were very friendly and handled some faxes for me quite efficiently. I had an "executive" room on a high floor which meant it was quiet and warm. Despite it being mid-January I don't think the heat came on even once. The bed was comfortable, the room & bath were clean, nice amenities and the clock radio worked. The phone sets and the TV are in need of a refresh but they worked just fine. Likewise the fitness room equipment is a bit dated but apart from being rather noisy, they performed adequately. There was a Globe & Mail newspaper outside the door each morning which was most appreciated. Also the proximity of the St. George TTC station makes the rest of the city easy to access. The Fox & Fiddle restaurant adjoined to the hotel is not worth your time. I tried breakfast there once and did not return - expensive, small portions and indifferent wait staff. There are many other food options along Bloor that are much better choices for variety and cost. This hotel was good value for the rate and the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Barely OK”
Reviews.Author: baabaaSudburyON
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was on the Santa Claus Parade route. We've stayed at every other major hotel in Toronto, but this was our first time here. First off, I booked a King bed Executive room. There was nothing executive about this room, from the back-crippling plank of wood I had to sleep on to the smallish quarters. All to the tune of $300. Then the complimentary cocktail tickets for the Fox and Fiddle adjacent to the hotel, which the bar did not honour and that's probably not the hotels fault but it irked me none the less. And then as we were leaving the hotel's underground parking, I see a parking ticket under my blade for $37 ! Go back into the hotel and inquire about this and they tell me that I must not have given them my license plate number, which of course, I had. We'll see if this ticket ends up on my credit card bill. Staff was helpful and polite though, I do have to say but that is not enough to ever have me stay there again. There are many other beautiful hotels in Toronto to choose from for that kind of money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: Edricson
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights for a conference at UofT; the location of the hotel with regard to the university is excellent, and it is also easy to get here from the St George subway station. There is not much in the way of character or decor, but still it was a pleasant stay. Certainly compared to Europe it has things you don't really expect in a hotel of this class: bigger room, an actual bath (not a shower), free newspaper etc. (And free wireless is a plus). Service was always polite and helpful. The price does not include breakfast, but you can get a pretty decent one down at the restaurant attached to the lobby for around 12-15 CAD, which is not very bad. Overall I'd recommend this for short business stays. (But it's also good for places like The Annex, Royal Ontario Museum and the Bata Shoe Museum.)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Love2EatQC
Reviews.Content: Spent Thanksgiving weekend at the Holiday Inn on Bloor Street in Toronto and it was wonderful. Perfect location. Great, comfy beds and clean beyond belief rooms. The local colour of the neighbourhood is a welcome addition and its proximity to fabulous restaurants (Fresh and Over Easy), museums (the ROM and Gardiner), the subway, and lots of funky shopping west of the hotel and higher end (Winners, Holts, Indigo) to the east end makes this the best location in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great service... just be prepared for the prices”
Reviews.Author: DBJ1998
Reviews.Content: We got into the hotel at 1a. The front desk staff was awesome, even that late at night. They gave us the location of 24h restaurants nearby, as well as exchanged our money for free. There was parking adjacent to the building, so no hassles there. The only complaint we had was the air conditioning in the room seemed to be on the fritz. The room never seemed to get cold enough. But, that was a minor complaint. All in all, we had a great stay here. FYI, if you plan to drink, the prices are very high, almost as high as Downtown Chicago. We got a beer and a White Russian, and the cost was 14 dollars. Wow. In fact, I think the beer was the more expensive of the two.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: CJTravelerTexas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Midtown upon the recommendation of a friend; it was good advice. While not a luxury hotel, this property was clean, it is located within walking distance to a number of cultural sites and good restaurants, and the staff was incredibly friendly and efficient. I was allowed to check in early (10:00 AM) and the room was what I reserved. The rooms have free wireless capabilities. Two blocks from the hotel is the Royal Ontario Museum, which is well worth visiting. All my experiences with the staff was positive. I would return to this hotel should I have the occasion to return to Toronto for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “nice location of hotel”
Reviews.Author: priyunk
Reviews.Content: Placed very near to CN tower and in downtown toronto

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, OK Property”
Reviews.Author: Steveℜen
Reviews.Content: I spent three weeks at this property in April 2009 while attending a course at U of T. The hotel is located within walking distance to the University and a minutes to the St. George subway station. Check-in was painfully slow. It was a Sunday night and only one staff member was working at the front desk. The rooms are very basic. I had three seperate rooms during my stay. All the beds were comfortable and the rooms were fairly clean. The hotel itself is very dated and basic. I paid $139 a night. It is definately not the Sheraton Centre or King Eddy, but a decent property if you want to stay near the University.

Reviews.Title: “Forgotten wake up call, noisy room fan, lobby smells like sewage...”
Reviews.Author: velojmp
Reviews.Content: It is a Holiday Inn so my expectations were not of a luxury hotel - but the service was lacking (forgotten wake up calls, a long wait to be served for breakfast when there is nobody else in the restaurant). Dingy carpets, mid 80s style furnishings and a noisy room fan (for both heat and cooling). Feels like a roadside motel rather than a hotel in downtown Toronto. The lobby and attached restaurant smelled like a combination of sewage and onions - again dingy surroundings and the business centre? It's the computer in the lobby. The lobby itself was usually full of noisy travellers lounging (including on the floors) - has the feel of a dorm more than a hotel. Few restaurants in this area of Toronto beyond fast food and several pubs - all the same but with different names. A terrible experience - most certainly not a value as for 30-40 more I will stay at the intercontinental next time farther west on Bloor. Awful - avoid this mess.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: yarn_addict
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because it was near an appointment I had. I also selected it because the price was good. I was happy with my stay. The hotel was nice enough and the room was comfortable. The bathroom could have been a little cleaner but it was still cleaner than my bathroom at home. I like the thermostat. It was really easy to control the temperature in the room. Oh, I forgot to mention the staff were very friendly. I like that. It's nice when you can get a room for a decent price and the staff treat you nice.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: carlmonite
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights paying about 170 CAD. Absolutely not worth the price! All the hotel needs some refurbishment: rooms, carpets, gym room (forget about it!), hall, lobby ... everything. The only good thing about the hotel was the staff, very polite and friendly, like all Canadians. Also the room was large enough. It's the first time I stay in a Holiday Inn with such poor standards! For all 3 nights I stayed there, there was a homeless staying in the lobby late at night! Unbelieavable! Just in front of the hotel there is a 24/7 deli, very useful! Location isn't that bad. 10 minutes east to the shopping areas, 5 minutes west to the pubs and university places.

Reviews.Title: “Not actually MIDTOWN but good location!”
Reviews.Author: QwertyEnglandUK
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff - we have stayed here twice now. Internet is mainly wireless but there are some rooms with cables. Nearest "tube" stop just a very short walk away and 24 hour store just over the road. For those who don't know Toronto it is NOT in the middle of town but it is in a good spot for the university and for shopping too (boutiqe area is nearby as well as "brand" stores). Rooms are clean but although they have digital temperature control in the rooms the hotel does turn the air-con side of this off in the winter months. This means that if you like your room cool you have to rely on the (minimal) breeze from the window which is made, for safety reasons, to only open about six inches... There are lifts both up to rooms and down to car parks. We have never had to wait much for these. Breakfast is not included but the hotel has a bar/dining room off the main lobby and the service here is up-and-down according to who serves you. Some staff who do breakfast seem to get grumpy but we have also had a really great waitress here too. Of course there's no need to have to have breakfast here at all if you don't want to as the breakfast is extra - plenty of places to eat within a short walk. Don't be tempted to use a regular taxi to the airport from here though... It costs MORE than the hotel booked ones!

Reviews.Title: “Nice area in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: JuristeInternet
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situated in the North Downtown, close of the University Area, Museum (Bata'shoe Museum), restaurants and subways. This hotel is quiet, rooms are clean and a self-park parking is available.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: idish
Reviews.Content: Good location, quiet place, helpful staff. One night there was a roudy party in the room next to mine, I called the front desk and they had it stopped within 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: valmae
Reviews.Content: We had four nights at the Holiday Inn and really enjoyed it. The location is excellent in the university area which is vibrant, safe and interesting. We also considered the Courtyard Marriott which rates very well but is in a much busier area. The rooms are your standard three star but clean, quiet and comfortable. The front office staff were excellent booked several day trips for us. We had breakfast two mornings at the cafe on the ground floor which we enjoyed - just a local cafe but the owner was happy to chat to us and suggest day trip ideas. There is a complimentary guest laundry which was handy plus two free internet stations in reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynMaMa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for both business and pleasure. The location is terrific, close to everything we wanted. There are playgrounds nearby, a gym you can use through the hotel with a swimming pool, great museums, the university campus and restaurants. We had a great time. The bar and restaurant downstairs were not so great. I would avoid those. The staff was helpful and child friendly. The room was clean but on the small side. There is a little deli right across the street that picked up snacks at and breakfast. It was clean. There was a parking garage in the basement. The streets are very busy at night and the area seemed very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently fine”
Reviews.Author: servicecomesfirst
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Holiday Inn Midtown about 30 times over the past 5 years and my most recent visit was over the long weekend in early August. I travel to Toronto frequently for both pleasure and business. The location is terrific: close to shopping and the subway, and there are plenty of restaurants to choose from in the lively Bloor and Spadina area. (On the other hand, there are plenty of homeless people on the streets in this area, which means you are liable to be bothered for change every time you walk down Bloor.) The price for a room is very competitve given this hotel's downtown location. Check-in is always speedy and the long-time staff recognize me when I arrive, which is nice. I also like the parking garage: you don't need to take a ticket and there is always room on the first level (yes, at $22 a day, it is pricey, but everything in pricey in Toronto). For breakfast, I avoid the cafe connected to the lobby and head to Tim Hortons which is just down the street. The hotel has been refurbished over the years and my room is always clean. In 30 visits, I have never been bothered with noise from other guests. All in all, you can't go wrong at the Holiday Inn Midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Back again”
Reviews.Author: DesertCabin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Holiday Inn, Midtown which has become a kind of home from home for us in Toronto. This is the most consistently excellent hotel Iâ€™ve ever stayed in. The rooms are always comfortable and the staff helpful, knowledgeable and flexible. We arrived separately, my husband on his way back from a mega journey to South America, me from visiting my daughter in nearby Waterloo. Normally we would have had to wait until 3.00 to get into our room, but staff let us in early so I could relax and unpack instead of wandering the streets. They also organised a taxi to the airport for our unbearably early flight to Vancouver. If I were to guess why the quality of the staff at this hotel is so high, Iâ€™d say itâ€™s because they are unionised â€“ which means that theyâ€™re paid and treated decently. A pretty rare thing in the hospitality industry these days.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for University of Toronto visitors”
Reviews.Author: Malingshu
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I stayed at the hotel on a business trip to the University of Toronto which is a short walk away. Although the rooms are a getting a little shabby they are quite spacious. The internet connection in the room was good (and free!). There are two computer terminals in the lobby with printers but these are always in use so don't planning on printing at the last minute. The pub where breakfast is served is okay - the menu offers mostly eggs and fried potato so gets a bit boring after a few days. The hotel staff take a while to warm up - they could barely say hello when we arrived but were very hospitable when we left! Great location - close to subway, shops, museums, and cafes serving good Asian food. Would recommend to travelling academics and students.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel at Good Price in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DevaEboracum
Reviews.Content: Having been to Toronto a number of times in the past, I knew which areas I wanted to stay in - but the challenge was finding a hotel at a good price. The Holiday Inn on Bloor Street did the job perfectly. The reception was OK, the room was OK, but the location was perfect - just 5 or 10 minutes away from Yong St, Bay St and the University. I would definitely stay here again - and probably will do on my next trip to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, good location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: silvertone953
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three night in sept 07 and found the room to be clean, comfortable and a reasonble size. Being part of a chain it's similar to rooms in any other Holiday Inn. Daily parking fee was $22 - seemed slightly high but the wifi was free in the rooms (and there's a couple of computers for customer use in the lobby too). Room service was reasonably priced and the food was good. Breakfast however wasn't great. Excellent location for the nearby fancy stores.

Reviews.Title: “Not very nice”
Reviews.Author: teakytick
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband in Sept 2007 for two nights as part of a driving holiday around New England and Eastern Canada. Where do I start? The staff member who checked us in was not very welcoming. We were given room 309, which was above the gym and next to the ice dispenser, both of which were noisy during the night, so much so that I got up and yanked the plug for the ice maker out of the plug socket just to reduce the noise. The room smelt musty and so did the pillows and sheets on the beds. The bathroom hadnâ€™t been cleaned fully and the towels were stained. For breakfast there is a â€˜pubâ€™ on the ground flour which serves the usual potatoes with everything. Its OK if you are used to greasy cafes. The only good thing about the hotel is its location, near to the metro station and the Ontario Museum. (Warning about this museum its not fully completed, so a lot of the exhibitions are closed, in particular the well publicised dinosaurs, and we were not told about this when we bought the tickets). Overall I would not recommend this hotel. (P.S. Do not go to the 360 Restaurant in the CN tower as the food is awful â€“ how can salmon not taste of salmon? Just go to the tower for the views instead) (Saving grace in Toronto was a restaurant called Mortonâ€™s on The Avenue, great service and the best steaks weâ€™ve ever tasted!)

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations at the Holiday Inn midtown”
Reviews.Author: sonofagunn
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a short break in Canada. The Holiday Inn midtown was our base in Toronto. We had a suite on the 12th floor - essentially, this is just a standard room with the addition of a small lounge area with it's own TV. The cost is not much more than a standard room however so it is actually worth it to have a little bit more space. The reception staff were extremely friendly, even calling up to the room after we had settled in to make sure everything was to our satisfaction. We ate breakfast and one evening meal at the Fox and Fiddle pub which is part of the hotel. This represented reasonable food and good value for money. It's a chain pub - if I had to give it a UK comparison, I'd say akin to a Brewer's Fayer. It's good for the convenience and value, but suffice to say, in a multi-cultural city like Toronto, there are better places to eat. The location of the hotel is excellent. I was a little concerned at first that we were a little bit out of the way, however this turned out to be a blessing. The area around the hotel was a bustling neighbourhood but quieter than downtime. Didn't see any beggars or homeless folks in this neighbourhood. The hotel is very convenient for the Subway which is just round the corner on St Georges street giving access to both north/south and east/west trains. We also walked all the way down to the waterfront one day via Yonge Street. It is a long walk and took us around half an hour but walking is the best way to see the attractions of this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, watch out for 'The Express Cafe' downstairs though”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghGreyhound
Reviews.Content: Excellent room and extremely helpful service from front desk staff. Overall, great value. Bad experience at the 'Express Cafe' immediately downstairs though. Although the cafe is not officially part of the hotel, the menu is in the package in your room and the cafe does use the hotel's washrooms. I would advise avoiding this place. When we visited for breakfast, the plastic menus were covered in grease and really old food residue, the tables hadn't been cleaned although it wasn't that busy and there were staff doing nothing behind the counter, and the breakfast itself was the worst I've experienced in Toronto ( half cooked, half cold, inedible). Needless to say, wishing to avoid the possibility of salmonella, we left sharpish.

Reviews.Title: “The best mid-range hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: beckstrous
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Holiday Inn Midtown twice and I've been to Toronto on four separate occasions overall - this hotel is the best place I have stayed in there. It's in a great location on Bloor Street West, round the corner from the St George subway and opposite the Bata Shoe museum (an fascinating place). It's also in the Annex neighbourhood, which seems quite interesting. And you can walk to the big shops downtown in about 10-15 minutes. The staff at this hotel are really friendly and phoned our room 10 minutes after check-in to make sure everything was OK. The room was quite spacious and felt a comfortable place for an extended stay. We had a couple of chairs and a table and everything was very clean; the furnishings felt solid and the bed was comfy. There's a small fitness room in this hotel (it has a couple of treadmills, bike, cross trainer, TV), and if you prefer a larger gym then they give you free access to a big one down the road. I also like the fact that they support recycling and give you a recycling box alongside your normal bin. I've just come back from a 3-week trip across Canada and the Holiday Inn was one of the only hotels to do this. We stayed in Toronto at the start of our trip and also at the end. At the end, we decided to stay in the Days Inn Downtown as it was slightly cheaper. We really regretted it - although it's slap-bang in the centre of downtown it felt extremely cheap (like a Travelodge), the bed was saggy and the room wasn't anywhere as nice as the one at the Holiday Inn. Unless I suddenly win the lottery, the Holiday Inn Midtown will always be the first place I look at when I'm after accomodation in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Good location / good stay”
Reviews.Author: sualau
Reviews.Content: Well-located for downtown, the U of Toronto and Ryerson, which is what we were there to visit. The front desk staff was very cheerful and helpful with advice, directions and ordering an airport shuttle. It's also easy to get a taxi out front in the event of rain or a longer commute. The bed and pillows were comfy and the room was clean and well-furnished. There are two computers in the lobby for Internet Access and the little coffee cafe out front has super coffee and food. I was using the computer one day and another customer said, "Watch your purse--my wife's was picked up here 2 weeks ago." I was a little surprised, but as there is a busy street out front and a lot of traffic through the lobby, maybe it's best to stay alert. Don't let that keep you from utilizing a clean, dependable hotel with courteous and professional employees.

Reviews.Title: “reasonably priced hotel near U of T but false fire alarms cause disruption”
Reviews.Author: ip_diva
Reviews.Content: reasonably priced, recently renovated hotel with free Internet & standard amenities. At night there is no manager on duty and the staff are not empowered to solve any problems. Twice while staying here there's been a false alarm with the fire alarm system, causing lengthy annoyance and inconvenience. The fire dept found nothing so it appears the hotel does not maintain these facilities and are complete slugs at trying to get the situation resolved. This time we were all roused for almost an hour. The prior time the alarm ran for almost an hour and the speaker was on all night so all guests could listen to the front desk staff at work, rustling papers & doing their work. *Any* problem of this nature makes for a terrible rating. I expect a quiet night's sleep and malfunctioning fire alarms are a great disturbance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: CincySwords
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Holiday Inn Midtown twice now, first in 2005 and again in August 2007. It's a nice, comfortable hotel. Nothing spectacular as far as the rooms or lobby or anything goes, but a clean and comfortable place to stay. What really makes it a great place is the location. It's right at Bloor & St. George, next to the U of T campus. So you can quite easily walk either west down Bloor and hit all the spots in the Annex, or east into Yorkville. It's also just across from the St. George subway station, so it's very convenient if you need to get further afield via public transportation. Given the location, I find the prices to be quite reasonable. Our room rate on this most recent trip was $136 (CDN), with taxes and parking ($22 a day, but unlimited in/out) it came to around $175. Given that I've paid over $100 before to stay in mediocre hotels up in North York or Markham where it's a good hour plus drive downtown, I can't beat this price. I would certainly stay again and recommend it to anyone traveling to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CAtravel07
Reviews.Content: WOW...This hotel is an excellent hotel. I just got back from a 5 night stay with family at this hotel. At first, we were hesitant on booking because we weren't quite sure of where it was in Toronto, and whether or not it was a good hotel. When we got there, we knew we made the right choice. Everything about this hotel is just superb. The Front Desk was extremely polite and helpful, even though the day we checked in was [the woman assisting us]'s second day as a trainee. It was a quick process and they had a room ready for us before 3! The room is a bit small...but perfect for us. We have a family of four, and we had to have a rollaway bed because my brother hurt his leg. This was a little problem fitting it into the room, but we managed. The beds were amazing! They were very very VERY comfortable, and the pillows were nice, too! The bathroom can get very stuffy while showering, but it clears in a little while. I loved the room we stayed in, even though it was facing the alley! Staff was very friendly and helpful. Housekeeping even arranged my siblings' stuffed animals on the bed! Parking was good- underground with direct access to the hotel lobby, and the location..OH! Location was fabulous! It is located within walking distance of the ROM[ Royal Ontario Museum], across from the Bata Shoe Museum, and so close to the Bloor-Yorkville district of Toronto. The stores there at fantastic. This hotel is great if you want to get some shopping done easily! Overall, my family and I love this hotel, and would definitely recommend it to anyone coming to Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, standard hotel - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: seaward14
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night while on vacation, and found it to be perfectly adequate for our purposes. The rooms are smallish and clean with all standard amenities (including internet), and many have a decent view. There's no pool, but use of the nearby community centre is apparently included - we didn't visit this facility during our stay. Staff were friendly, but it's a pretty large hotel, so you're mainly left to your own devices. The location is just great - literally steps away from the subway, right across from the shoe museum, and just down the block from the ROM and loads of shopping. The only snag was a malfunctioning fire alarm which kept us awake for a time during the early morning. Although I recognize these things do happen, I would have appreciated a word of apology from the front desk staff on check-out for the lost sleep. All in all, however, this is a perfectly acceptable hotel in an excellent location. If you can get a good rate, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “tasty Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Haydn W
Reviews.Content: We had to stay at the Holiday Inn Midtown on Bloor St, as the B&B we had originally booked at took on a long term lease and all bookings were cancelled. (Luckily we had re-confirmed our accommodation a fortnight before arriving, so we knew we were cancelled.) There was a huge conference in town, so not much accommodation was left over....So a Holiday Inn is a Holiday Inn (i'm a Priority Club member so that's cool), the Hotel itself looks over the Street at what looks like University Accommodation, it probably was as the Uni is very close by. The rooms are clean, comfortable and functional, no suprise there, the fitness room/gym is pretty much useless, but they do offer free passes to a fantastic local gym about 2 minutes walk down the road, that was great. The in-house restaurant and pub was good, great standard pub food and drinks. Bloor street is the selling point for this Hotel, which suprised me, you can do your credit card some serious damage at the high-end shops only a few minutes walk east along Bloor. The train station is very close by as well, so getting down town is really easy.

Reviews.Title: “A good deal!”
Reviews.Author: deenaclaire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn on Bloor St. West as part of an Orbitz package that included airfare. The hotel was very good - clean room, bathroom, halls. The front desk personnel were very helpful to us, and their attached pub/restaurant was certainly above average. We had no criticisms. Location is excellent, and we were able to use public transportation every day to explore Toronto's neighborhoods.

Reviews.Title: “Super!”
Reviews.Author: Wildlilac
Reviews.Content: 1. Great location! You can walk anywhere or if you prefer there is a subway stop nearby. The Royal Ontario Museum (ROM) is a 5-minute walk. 2. Clean and bright - the bed that we slept on was slightly squeaky though (no big deal). 3. Wireless access in the room - although there are two computers for free Internet access in the lobby. 4. Friendly staff. 5. Pillow menu - four different types of pillow to choose from. 6. Breakfast not included - plenty of places to go on Bloor St. for breakfast and there is a pub and a cafe on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Cool Location with less cost”
Reviews.Author: jliles
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, clean, friendly, etc. We took a limo/cab from the airport for $45 CA. The location was optimum in my opinion: The subway was right around the corner and a trip to the CN tower was accomplished in a half hour for $2.50 CA. The trolley was a 10 min walk and was a straight shot to the Exhibition Place (just over 30 min total). Walking was safe and everyone was out and about. If you head left from the hotel you get in to some high dollar stores and hotels. Head to the right and there are restaurants abounding. Most have an open eating area on the sidewalk. Particularly good was Real Thailand Restaurant. Directly accross the street is a mini market open 24 hours a day.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with "can do" attitude”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean and convenient hotel in the heart of Toronto. Staff were courteous, friendly and helpful. Rooms were well appointed, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Above average for value”
Reviews.Author: Pumes
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an excellent deal. The location is truly outstanding if you're a fan of shopping/dining out. There's a convenience store right across the street, and a subway station a block and a half away. You're not going to be blown away by luxurious surroundings but . . . it is a Holiday Inn. Our room was pretty spacious for the price, immaculate and comfortable. Our view was, unfortuntately, another building. The Eaton Centre is a bit of a walk away, but the hotel is in the middle of the Yorkville district, with tons of boutique shopping available. There are also a number of teriffic restaurants in every price range within easy walking distance from the hotel. The only problem that we had was that the lock on our door became stuck and we were (briefly) locked in our hotel room. The staff came up within five minutes to let us out.

Reviews.Title: “can't beat the price for location”
Reviews.Author: Blackiefazz
Reviews.Content: Although it was very cold outside & snowing, we were comfortable and within walking distance to a majority of small restaurants & the Yorkville shopping area. For us, a clean room for sleeping & showering is the base for our stay- the City is what we were really interested in.The room s are standard fare- clean & comfortable. The adjoining restaurant/ bar were accomodating, esp. after a chilled walk. Convenience & drug store about a block away. No need for major hotel frills. Oh, it's often not mentioned the hotel does not participate in frequent fliers milage for USA citizens. There is also a parking garage, which charges per day & adds up quite fast, since there are a variety of taxes. But parking is available- difficult to find on the street. We stay there each year to visit family & have been very pleased. Will go back again

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, O.K hotel”
Reviews.Author: CdnWT
Reviews.Content: Rest assured, this hotel if FINE. Yes, it is limited in terms of service and currently undergoing renovations but this is all mentionned upon making reservations (at the time of writing this review, renovations should have been completed). We stayed at the Quality (just changed it's name to Holiday Inn Midtown) and for the price we paid in downtown Toronto, it was perfectly fine. You just can't expect a glamorous 5-star hotel when paying 150$CAN per night in T. O. Still, that being said, I found our accomodation of good quality, especially for a Quality Hotel. Carpets and flooring are brand-new through the hotel, most furniture in the room was too, but small things such as bedside tables and curtains haven't been changed yet (reception staff told us that the furniture was arriving progressively week by week to avoid closing down a whole floor in the summer season, which makes sense). A/C was central and very cold, something I haven't seen often in Quality Hotels and it's great! Room and bathroom were clean and modern. They are no fitness facilities, pool or saunas on-site but you do have access to one If you ask. We did use the free wireless high-speed internet in the room (8th floor) and the connection worked like a charm (and fast). The Fox and Fiddle restaurant on-site didn't really impress me nor my friends. Orange juice was made out of powder and expensive (2.75$!) and wait staff was uninterested. The small cafÃ© by the lobby is the opposite, friendly and affordable with great offerings. There is a 24-hour grocery store directly in front of the hotel, very convenient. The location is not bad, it's in a quieter area of downtown Toronto, near fashionable Yorkville and Avenue Road (a 2-3 min. walk) but you are not close to the Eaton centre. It all depends on what you're planning to do. Subway is a 2 min walk and will get you there quickly. Our room faced Bloor St. and we slept well, but the back rooms are surely more quiet. Cons: Maid service only provided us with 1 face cloth and 2 towels the first day, none the 2nd day and we had to call for extras both nights. It took ages for them to send some. Plan on waiting a good 30-45 minutes If it happens to you. That's how long it took us both times. Half of the front desk clerks were unhelpful and bordering on the rude side. The other ones were fine but with limited knowledge. If you are used to some nice advice by the concierge at The Hilton or Marriott, then, you will be deceived. In the end, If you've booked, don't cancel, it's a perfectly FINE hotel and I personally don't believe it's a dump at all. Renovations were nearly finished at the end of June and should hopefully be finished by the time you get there.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation madness”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there June 13-18, 2005. The location is marvelous, however, renovations made the room unbearable for a large portion of the day. Banging, sawing, you name it, made our lives miserable. Apparently, they have never heard of the term, "Service Elevator", so you wait and wait, and wait some more for the workers to get where they're going. The management should have done the responsable thing: either give everybody a price reduction or hang a sign on the front door, "Closed for renovations." It must be noted that the hotel did inform us ahead of time that there were renovations taking place. They assured us over the phone that we would be given a room high enough so as not to be bothered; sadly, that was not the case. Sure, renovations end; however, they do so a lot quicker than attitudes. And it's the latter that are the real problem with the Quality Midtown. We looked at other hotels in the same area. There's a bed and breakfast on Madison St. (a few blocks away) that looked charming (unfortunately, it was booked). That would be my first choice if I returned. If you're interested in a comparable hotel in the same area for about the same price as Quality Midtown, I'd recommend that you take a long look at Howard Johnsons.

Reviews.Title: “This Place is a Dump,”
Reviews.Author: TrvlrX
Reviews.Content: but as long as you understand that, you will be fine. The rooms are worn, carpets are threadbare, furniture in common areas is either missing or broken, only one of three lifts seems to work at any time and you will fight with laundry cart wielding staff and construction workers for a spot to ride it. On the plus side the rooms, while tattered, are very clean and fresh smelling. Our room on the west side of the 9th floor had a distant view of the lake.
